com.symyx.draw
Interface JDrawComponent

All Known Implementing Classes:
Editor, JDrawEditor, JDrawRenderer, Renderer
public interface JDrawComponent

Interface for the class that renders or edits structures (molecules and reactions) in an applet or application. For an applet, use JDrawEditor. For an application, use Editor. Whereas the JDrawRenderer (for an applet) and Renderer (for an application) can only display structures, an editor can create, display, and modify structures. Typically, the structure is represented by a molfile or reaction. To learn about the molfile and rxnfile formats, see www.symyx.com/downloads/public/ctfile/ctfile.pdf.

Method Detail

clearMolecule

void clearMolecule()
Resets the canvas to a blank state without any molecule or reaction.

setMolecule

void setMolecule(java.net.URL molURL)
Sets the molecule or reaction to display.

Parameters:
molURL - the molecule or reaction to display

getMolString

java.lang.String getMolString()
Returns a String that represents the molecule or reaction currently displayed. A molfile string is the content of a molfile (.mol) or rxnfile (.rxn), and it contains line feed and/or carriage returns as line separators.

Returns:
String the molecule or reaction currently displayed.

getMolString

java.lang.String getMolString(java.lang.String newLineSequence)

setMolString

void setMolString(java.lang.String molString)
Sets the molecule or reaction to display.

Parameters:
molString - molfile string that represents the molecule or reaction to display

getRxnString

java.lang.String getRxnString()
Returns a string that returns the reaction. Note: RxnStrings are a subset of MolStrings that represents reactions. Whereas setRxnString and setMolstring both work with molecules and reactions, getRxnString returns soley reaction data (or null if no reaction is drawn on the canvas).

Returns:
a string that represents the reaction

getRxnString

java.lang.String getRxnString(java.lang.String newLineSequence)

setRxnString

Sets the rxnString

Parameters:
rxnString - the reaction String

getChimeString

java.lang.String getChimeString()
Returns a chimestring that represents the molecule or reaction currently displayed. Note: this format is internal to Symyx.

Parameters:
String - the molecule or reaction currently displayed.

setChimeString

void setChimeString(java.lang.String chimeString)
Sets the chimestring that represents the molecule or reaction to display. Note: this format is internal to Symyx.

Parameters:
String - the chimestring that represents the molecule or reaction to display

setHydrogenDisplayMode

boolean setHydrogenDisplayMode(int i)
Deprecated. Instead use preferences().setHydrogenDisplayMode(int hydrogenDisplayMode)

Determines which hydrogen atoms are displayed.
  • 0 for none
  • 1 for hydrogens attached to heteroatoms
  • 2 for terminal hydrogens (not inside chains)
  • 3 for hetereo or terminal
  • 4 for all

Default is 0.

If the value is outside the range or the editor does not have a renderer ready for accepting setting the preference, the call is ignored and false is returned.

preferences

JDrawPreferences preferences()
Returns the preference manager object, a unified object that provides access to preference values. For example, 

someJDrawAppletInstance.preferences().setHydrogenDisplayMode(PreferenceManager.HYDROGEN_TERMINAL)
Note: Calling this method automatically redraws the canvas of an applet.
